ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 12 hours per week on average, sometimes more or sometimes less.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Professor Tschudi is very knowledgable within the field and it was a pleasure to take a class from him. Both professors of the course were very prompt in providing feedback and gave much constructive criticism.

Instructor: Diane McMahon-Pratt  Professor McMahon-Pratt is very knowledgable within the field and it was a pleasure to take a class from her. Both professors of the course were very prompt in providing feedback and gave much constructive criticism.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This was a very strong course, both as an overview of the neglected tropical diseases biology and as a training in critically reading and evaluating literature in the field. I felt great growth from the beginning of the class to the end of the class. I would strongly recommend this class for anyone seeking a higher level course and discussion of the issues facing researchers of tropical disease medicine.
